com.gemalto.idp.mobile.otp.gpfds

Class GpfDsFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.gemalto.idp.mobile.otp.gpfds.GpfDsFactory

  • public final class GpfDsFactory
extends java.lang.Object
    A factory for creating objects that produce or affect GpfDs (or its relatives) OTPs.
    Since:
    4.0

      • createSoftGpfDsSettings

        public SoftGpfDsSettings createSoftGpfDsSettings()
        Create a mutable copy of the default GPF DS settings used for soft tokens.
        Returns:

      • createGpfDsDevice

        public GpfDsDevice createGpfDsDevice(CapToken token)
                              throws IdpException
        Creates a Hardware or Software Gemalto Proprietary Framework (GPF) Dynamic Signature (DS) device. Warning! Currently Mobile Protector SDK library only supports Software GPF DS device.

        If the token is soft, i.e Token.isSoft() is true, the default GPF DS settings are used otherwise the device settings are used.

        Parameters:
        token - The CAP token
        Returns:
        The Gpf DS device
        Throws:
        IdpException - this is generic exception, you can directly catch this exception or catch each specific exception below.
        IdpStorageException - when there is a database operation failure.
        DeviceFingerprintException - when the token's fingerprint checksum does not match.
        PasswordManagerException - when the TOKEN domain is not logged in (using one of the password managers)

      • createSoftGpfDsDevice

        public GpfDsDevice createSoftGpfDsDevice(SoftCapToken token,
                                         SoftGpfDsSettings settings)
                                  throws IdpException
        Creates a Software Gemalto Proprietary Framework (GPF) Dynamic Signature (DS) device using the given settings. This method may only be used for soft tokens, i.e Token.isSoft() is true.
        Parameters:
        token - the soft token
        settings - the GPF DS settings
        Returns:
        the Gpf DS device
        Throws:
        IdpException - this is generic exception, you can directly catch this exception or catch each specific exception below.
        IdpStorageException - when there is a database operation failure.
        DeviceFingerprintException - when the token's fingerprint checksum does not match.
        PasswordManagerException - when the TOKEN domain is not logged in (using one of the password managers)
